'''Clonezilla''' is a [[free software|free]] [[disaster recovery]], [[disk cloning]], [[Disk image|disk imaging]] and deployment solution.<ref name="DW">{{cite web|url=http://distrowatch.com/table.php?distribution=clonezilla|title= DistroWatch.com: Clonezilla|accessdate= 14 September 2010}}</ref> Clonezilla is designed by Steven Shiau and developed by the [[National Center for High-Performance Computing|NCHC]] Free Software Labs in [[Taiwan]].<ref name="OSNews">{{cite web|url=http://www.osnews.com/story/23054/Disk_Imaging_with_Clonezilla|title= Interview with Steven Shiau|accessdate= 14 September 2010}}</ref> Clonezilla SE provides multicast support similar to Norton Ghost Corporate Edition.
== Clonezilla Live == 'Clonezilla Live' enables a user to clone a single computer's storage media, or a single partition on the media, to a separate medium device. The cloned data can be saved as an image-file or as a duplicated copy of the data. The data can be saved to locally attached storage device, an [[Secure shell|SSH]] server, a [[Samba (software)|Samba Server]], or an [[Distributed file system|NFS]] file-share. The clone file can then be used to restore the original when needed.
The Clonezilla application can be run from a USB flash drive, a CD-ROM, or a DVD-ROM. Clonezilla requires no modification to the computer; the software runs in its own booted environment.
== Clonezilla Server == Clonezilla Server is used to clone many computers simultaneously across a network. This is done using a [[DRBL]] server and computer workstations that can boot from a network.
